content:
SubjectIdentifier Class

Definition

The SubjectIdentifier class defines the type of the identifier of a subject, such as a CmsSigner or a CmsRecipient. The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number or the subject key.

In this Article

public sealed class SubjectIdentifier
Inheritance
System.Object
SubjectIdentifier

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Properties

Type

The Type property retrieves the type of subject identifier. The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number or the subject key.

public System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType Type { get; }
Value
SubjectIdentifierType

A member of the SubjectIdentifierType enumeration that identifies the type of subject.

Value

The Value property retrieves the value of the subject identifier. Use the stem.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier.Type* property to determine the type of subject identifier, and use the Value property to retrieve the corresponding value.

public object Value { get; }
Value
System.Object

An Object object that represents the value of the subject identifier. This Object can be one of the following objects as determined by the stem.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier.Type* property.

stem.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier.Type* property
 Object
IssuerAndSerialNumber
X509IssuerSerial
SubjectKeyIdentifier
String
